config: We've compiled a list of five crazy love-related laws you may not believe exist.

config.description: Despite being the city which is home to the famed “Callejón del Beso” (Kissing Alley), a law passed in 2009 prohibited kissing in public in Guanajuato, Mexico.
In Vermont, United States, women needing false teeth must first get written permission from their husbands to do so.
In France, it has been illegal to kiss in train stations and especially on their platforms since 1910.
In North Carolina, United States, if a man and woman who aren’t married go to a hotel and register themselves as married, then according to state law, they are married.
In Wichita, Kansas, the mistreatment of mothers-in-law can be used as grounds for divorce. So you’d better be nice to your mother-in-law if you want to keep your marriage!
